adept.common

Class TokenStream

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.AbstractCollection<E>
      • java.util.AbstractList<E>
        • java.util.ArrayList<Token>
          • adept.common.TokenStream
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Cloneable, Iterable<Token>, Collection<Token>, List<Token>, RandomAccess

    public class TokenStream
extends ArrayList<Token>
implements Serializable
    The Class TokenStream, which is a list of tokens and represents the tokenized form of a entire document. If multiple tokenizers are used then a document may contain multiple TokenStream objects.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      void reAlignToText(String text)
      Locate each token in this stream by its value (as it appears as a substring in getTextValue()), and shift its charOffset to align with the corresponding substring in the given equivalent text (i.e., the text must consist of the same token values in the same order, but may differ with regard to whitespace characters around/between the tokens).

      • findPhrase

        public TokenOffset findPhrase(String phrase)
        Find the token offset of the given phrase, which represents a list of tokens for which to search. This method first attempts to do a token-value-to-token-value match of the tokenized phrase's token values to this stream's token values. If that fails, it will fall back to performing a string-based search for the phrase itself inside a single string generated from this stream's token values. The result of the fall-back attempt, if present, may represent a case where the beginning and/or end of the phrase intersects the token value(s) at the boundary(ies) of the returned offset.
        Parameters:
        phrase - the phrase for which to search, which represents a list of tokens for which to search.
        Returns:
        the token offset that represents the result, or null if the phrase was not found

      • findPhrase

        public TokenOffset findPhrase(String phrase,
                              TokenOffset tokenOffset)
        Find the token offset of the given phrase, which represents a list of tokens for which to search. This method first attempts to do a token-value-to-token-value match of the tokenized phrase's token values to this stream's token values. If that fails, it will fall back to performing a string-based search for the phrase itself inside a single string generated from this stream's token values. The result of the fall-back attempt, if present, may represent a case where the beginning and/or end of the phrase intersects the token value(s) at the boundary(ies) of the returned offset.
        Parameters:
        phrase - the phrase for which to search, which represents a list of tokens for which to search.
        tokenOffset - a token offset that limits the search space
        Returns:
        the token offset that represents the result, or null if the phrase was not found

      • tokenValues

        public List<String> tokenValues()

      • tokenValues

        public List<String> tokenValues(TokenOffset tokenOffset)

      • reAlignToText

        public void reAlignToText(String text)
        Locate each token in this stream by its value (as it appears as a substring in getTextValue()), and shift its charOffset to align with the corresponding substring in the given equivalent text (i.e., the text must consist of the same token values in the same order, but may differ with regard to whitespace characters around/between the tokens). Also then set this stream's text value to be the argument.
